clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in Muscle Morphology Resulting From Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Muscle Morphology Resulting From ACL Reconstruction: Impact on Strength and Function

primary_outcome.description: Measured on bilateral MRI taken from ischial tuberosity to 10 cm below knee joint line

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee flexion and extension isokinetic strength
secondary_outcome.description: Eccentric anc concentric strength measured at 60, 150, and 270 degrees/second on dynamometer in sitting and in 5 degrees hip flexion

arm_group.description: ACL reconstruction with autograft harvest of STG from ACL-deficient leg

arm_group.arm_group_label: Autograft harvest of STG from ACL-deficient leg
arm_group.description: Autograft harvest of STG from leg contralateral to ACL-deficient leg

intervention.intervention_name: Autograft STG harvest from ACL-deficient leg
intervention.description: Semitendinosus-gracilis graft harvest is undertaken on same limb that is undergoing ACL reconstruction

intervention.intervention_name: Autograft harvest contralateral to ACL-deficient leg
intervention.description: Semitendinosus-gracilis graft harvest is undertaken on limb contralateral to that undergoing ACL reconstruction
intervention.arm_group_label: Autograft harvest of STG from ACL-deficient leg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- between 18 and 50 years old; isolated ACL rupture confirmed on MRI
Exclusion Criteria:
- other physical or mental health issues that affect ability to complete rehabilitation and/or study follow-ups
